ALANBOWMAN(7)                           Resume as man page                            ALANBOWMAN(7)

NAME

Alan Bowman - Technical Writer and User Advocate

SYNOPSIS

alanbowman [--technicalwriter] [--useradvocate] [--tester] [--other]

SUMMARY

I am a technical writer with over six years experience in creating documentation that helps users quickly and accurately find answers and solve problems so that they can create amazing software, web applications, and web sites. I am currently working as a contractor for a managed service provider, and my most recent permanent position was for a small web hosting company that focused on providing cloud-based solutions to small and medium-sized businesses and application developers. I also have 12 years experience as a UNIX/Linux system administrator and support tech, working for a division of a large multi-national and then for a smaller web hosting company.

This technical background, along with my documentation experience and user-centric focus, allows me to bridge the communications gap that often exists between the technical information provided by the company and the user-friendly documentation needed by the customer. This same technical background also allows me to work in a tester/QA role to find issues and suggest improvements in products and services.

I also have experience as a user advocate, working directly with the sales, marketing, and admin teams to solicit and review customer and staff feedback on products and services, and then providing suggestions ranging from website copy updates to business process changes.

OPTIONS

--technicalwriter

Created and maintained all customer-facing user guides and product release notes, internal technical guides for the support and network admin teams.
Standardized the process to create, maintain, and update all customer-facing documentation.
Improved ability of customers to find answers through self-service instead of contacting support.
Designed a company style guide and word list used across all departments.

Experienced in:

* documentation for RESTful APIs (JSON and XML)
* traditional user guides and release notes
* READMEs and man pages
* project management (managing both my own projects and my part of projects led by others)
* policy and procedure documentation

Also some experience with:

* documenting platform APIs using Doxygen and Javadoc
* JavaScript function/method documentation

My toolset includes: Vim, Pandoc, Markdown, Git, Postman, and a host of other open source tools that allow me to work quickly and efficiently, with low overhead and rapid turnaround time.

--useradvocate

Created an internal system for staff to report any user advocacy issues and designed a reporting structure to get those issues to management.
Consulted with the Development, Website, and Sales teams to review new products and services to ensure a consistent and easy to use UX/UI.

--tester

Helped overhaul the existing testing/QA process into a more streamlined system that reduced time required to launch for new products and services from months to weeks.

--other

Presentations:

Document Design: Basic Principles, Atlanta Atlassian User Group
